issues.description: The problem statement’s text in Part 2 specifies method signature messageOnMilk(double milkVolume), but the UML diagram, template usage, and solution define messageOnMilk() with no parameters. This mismatch will confuse students about which signature to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the problem statement with the UML and solution by removing the double milkVolume parameter from the description and examples, specifying messageOnMilk() as a parameterless method that returns a String.

issues.description: The problem text (lines 93–95 in problem_statement.md) specifies a method messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) that returns a string including the volume, but the code in Milkable.java (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Milkable.java) defines messageOnMilk() with no parameter and implementations omit the volume. This signature and semantic mismatch will confuse students about which method to implement and its expected behavior.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the specification and code by either (a) updating the problem statement to describe a parameterless messageOnMilk() method without volume, or (b) modifying the interface and implementations to messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and include the volume in the returned string.
